title: Mohammed Siraj seals thriller as India win Oval Test by 6 runs; draw series 2-2
content: India secured a thrilling 6-run victory against England in the final Test at The Oval, clinching the series. Mohammed Siraj's exceptional bowling performance, claiming five wickets, including three crucial dismissals on the final morning, turned the tide after England's strong start. Despite Joe Root and Harry Brook's centuries, India's unwavering belief and Siraj's heroics sealed the unforgettable win.

title: 'I gave him salaam, he slapped me': Flyer roughed up on IndiGo flight shares ordeal
content: Hoosain Ahmed Mazumdar, assaulted on an IndiGo flight from Mumbai to Kolkata, returned home after a harrowing 48 hours. His family accuses IndiGo of negligence, citing a lack of communication regarding his whereabouts after the incident. Mazumdar, a gym cleaner, was allegedly attacked by a co-passenger, Hafizur Rahman, mid-flight.

title: 'Be very cautious': Kremlin's warning to Trump over 'nuclear rhetoric'
content: The Kremlin has urged caution following Donald Trump's announcement of deploying two nuclear submarines closer to Russia. This action was a response to Dmitry Medvedev's provocative statements regarding nuclear capabilities. Trump emphasized the deployment as a precaution, highlighting the US's readiness to protect its people amidst escalating tensions and potential new sanctions against Russia.

title: Cong ignores SC rap, doubles down on China claim; takes 'DDLJ' jab at Centre
content: The Supreme Court's criticism of Rahul Gandhi's remarks on the India-China border standoff has ignited a political firestorm. The BJP has accused Gandhi of being "anti-national" and undermining national security, citing his comments on Chinese incursions.

title: 'Not young, but gun': Shubman Gill reveals Gambhir's fired-up mantra
content: Shubman Gill was named India’s ‘Player of the Series’ after scoring 754 runs, which included four centuries. His standout performances included scores of 147 in Leeds, 269 and 161 in Birmingham, and 103 in Manchester.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai to employees: ‘I think we have to....'
content: Google's CEO Sundar Pichai and executives like Brian Saluzzo are urging employees to accelerate the integration of AI into their workflows, aiming for increased productivity and efficiency. This push includes internal AI tools like Cider and training programs developed with DeepMind, such as "Building with Gemini," to enhance software engineers' capabilities.

title: Delhi moves to regulate private school fees; Sood slams 'mafias', says education isn't for sale
content: Delhi government proposes a bill to control private school fees. The move follows protests over fee hikes. Many schools increased fees significantly, burdening parents. The bill seeks to ensure transparency and prevent commercialization. It includes penalties for schools violating regulations. It also establishes a grievance system for parents. The bill aims to balance regulation and school autonomy.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Breakup ke baad bhi dukh hota hai' - Siraj opens up after topsy-turvy series
content: Mohammed Siraj's exceptional performance, highlighted by a crucial final-day spell, secured India's thrilling six-run victory against England, leveling the series 2-2. HIs decisive dismissal of Gus Atkinson with a searing yorker, showcased his resilience and determination. Despite earlier setbacks, Siraj's unwavering belief and fiery spirit propelled India to a memorable win at The Oval.

title: Watch: Gavaskar celebrates Siraj's winning moment in Oval comm box
content: Mohammed Siraj's decisive yorker secured a thrilling six-run victory for India in the Oval Test, sparking celebrations both on and off the field. Sunil Gavaskar's enthusiastic applause in the commentary box highlighted the significance of the win. India's bowlers, spearheaded by Siraj, orchestrated a remarkable comeback, denying England a series victory and igniting pride among fans and legends alike.

title: US startup lists 70-hour weeks; echoes China’s 996 work culture in Silicon Valley
content: Silicon Valley AI startups are increasingly adopting China's controversial "996" work schedule, pushing employees to work extreme hours despite its outlaw status in China. Fueled by the global AI race and the ambition to build billion-dollar companies, this trend raises concerns about labor law compliance and worker exploitation, even as some Gen Z workers embrace the demanding culture.

title: TMC rift widens: Kalyan Banerjee quits as chief whip; slams Mahua Moitra
content: Kalyan Banerjee resigned as TMC's chief whip in Lok Sabha. This follows a public dispute with party MP Mahua Moitra. Banerjee criticized Moitra's comments made during a podcast. He deemed her language dehumanizing and uncivil. Banerjee defended his questions about public figures' conduct. He accused Moitra of personal attacks to deflect from her performance.

title: ‘What was the tearing hurry?’: SC questions UP govt on Banke Bihari ordinance
content: The Supreme Court has questioned the Uttar Pradesh government's decision to take over the Shri Banke Bihari temple management in Vrindavan, citing a lack of consultation with key stakeholders before the corridor project order on May 15. The court expressed concern over the state's urgency in enacting the ordinance and its approach to the court without informing involved parties.

title: 'I will change the game': Siraj's promise to himself before Day 5 heroics
content: Mohammed Siraj's stellar bowling helped India defeat England in a thrilling Test match at The Oval. India leveled the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series 2-2 with a narrow six-run victory. Siraj took five wickets, including a crucial three-wicket haul on the final day. His efforts secured India's narrowest Test win. Siraj finished as the series' highest wicket-taker with 23 wickets.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook confirms: Majority of new iPhones sold in US 'made' in India
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook stated that most iPhones sold in the US during the last quarter were made in India, despite Donald Trump's criticism of this manufacturing shift. India has become the main hub for iPhone production for the US market, while China focuses on non-US regions. Apple is experiencing record revenue growth in India, driven by strong iPhone sales.

title: IND vs ENG: 'When Siraj took that final wicket...': Brendon McCullum on India's hero
content: Brendon McCullum lauded Mohammed Siraj's match-winning performance in the fifth Test, acknowledging his fighting spirit. He described the series as an enthralling contest, highlighting the intense physical and mental demands on both teams. McCullum felt a 2-2 draw was a fair result, praising the players' resilience throughout the grueling five-match series, which he considered an 'unbelievable spectacle'.

title: Foxconn sells Lordstown plant for $88 million but keeps EV production running
content: Foxconn has finalized the sale of its Lordstown, Ohio, factory to Crescent Dune LLC for $88 million, while maintaining operations as a tenant. This move allows Foxconn to reinvest in US-based initiatives, focusing on electric vehicle production and advanced manufacturing. The sale reflects Foxconn's strategy to optimize assets and support growth in key sectors.

title: 'I downloaded belief' – Siraj reveals photo that inspired Oval heroics |Watch
content: Mohammed Siraj's inspired bowling performance led India to a thrilling 6-run victory over England at The Oval, drawing the series 2-2. Siraj, fueled by a 'believe' image and memories of his father, took key wickets, including Jamie Smith and Gus Atkinson.

title: That flutter in your chest? It’s an ectopic heartbeat—know this
content: Ectopic heartbeats, those occasional skipped or extra beats, are usually harmless and often triggered by caffeine, stress, or exercise. While unsettling, they rarely indicate a serious heart problem, especially in healthy individuals. However, if accompanied by chest pain, fainting, or shortness of breath, consulting a doctor is recommended to rule out underlying issues.

title: 'Nothing goes to waste': Zoo asks people to donate their pets to feed its predators
content: Aalborg Zoo in Denmark is now accepting unwanted small pets as donations to feed its predators. The zoo assures that donated animals like rabbits and guinea pigs will be humanely euthanized before being used as food. This initiative aims to mimic the natural food chain, promoting animal welfare and natural behaviour among captive carnivores.

title: IND vs ENG: Sachin Tendulkar gives his verdict on Test series - 10/10
content: Sachin Tendulkar lauded India's thrilling victory over England in the fifth Test at The Oval, leveling the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy 2-2. Mohammed Siraj's decisive yorker sealed the win after a tense final day. Shubman Gill highlighted the team's determination to shed the 'young team' label.

title: Russian oil: Crude continues to flow into India; no impact of Trump, EU pressure
content: Despite pressure from the US and EU, India continues importing Russian crude oil, with multiple tankers offloading millions of barrels at Indian refineries. This ongoing trade persists amidst warnings of potential punitive measures from the US and concerns over supporting Russia's Ukraine campaign.

title: 'He’s a captain’s dream' – Gill lauds Siraj’s warrior spirit after Oval five-for |Watch
content: Stand-in skipper Shubman Gill lauded his team's resilience after India's thrilling six-run victory over England in the fifth Test, leveling the series 2-2. Gill praised the bowlers, especially Mohammed Siraj's sensational spell of 5 for 88, and Prasidh Krishna's support, which led to England's collapse.

title: Japan’s oldest living person Shigeko Kagawa becomes 114-year-old longevity icon
content: Shigeko Kagawa, a 114-year-old retired physician, has been recognized as Japan's oldest living person, following the passing of Miyoko Hiroyasu. Kagawa attributes her longevity to a life of freedom, independence, and playfulness, embodying Japan's 'ikigai' philosophy. Japan's high life expectancy is attributed to factors like diet, active lifestyles, strong social connections, and accessible healthcare.

title: IND vs ENG: Ex-England skipper decries pre-series chatter over Bumrah - READ
content: Alastair Cook noted the surprising flatness of the pitches during the India-England Test series. He highlighted a curious trend: India lost the two matches where Jasprit Bumrah played, despite his impressive 14 wickets, including two five-wicket hauls.

title: 'Not having Rohit, Virat hit me': KL Rahul opens up after India's epic win
content: Mohammed Siraj's sensational five-wicket haul propelled India to a thrilling six-run victory over England at The Oval, drawing the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series 2-2. India's seamers dismantled England's lower order on the final morning, securing a dramatic comeback win despite missing key players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.

title: Shibu Soren passes away: PM Modi pays tribute, consoles Hemant at hospital
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid tribute to Shibu Soren, the late Jharkhand leader and former Chief Minister, at Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in Delhi. Soren, 81, had been battling kidney ailments. Modi met with Chief Minister Hemant Soren and family, expressing condolences. President Murmu and Governor Gangwar also mourned Soren's death, recognizing his contributions to social justice and tribal rights.

title: NBEMS 2025 exam calendar out: NEET SS, FMGE, DNB & more – see official notice
content: The National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences has announced the exam calendar for 2025. It includes dates for NEET SS, FMGE, and DNB-PDCET. NEET SS 2025 will occur in November. The FMGE screening test is scheduled for January 2026. Candidates should check the official website, natboard.edu.in, for details. Application dates and admit card releases will be announced online.

title: SpiceJet staffer assaulted by army officer says he 'can't move his back'
content: A SpiceJet ground staffer in Srinagar recounts being violently assaulted by an Indian Army officer over excess baggage, resulting in spinal fractures. The staffer emphasizes he was simply doing his duty when the officer, Lt. Col. R.K. Singh, allegedly attacked him and other colleagues after a dispute over baggage fees.

title: Over 3,000 Boeing fighter jet workers went on strike; here's why
content: More than 3,200 Boeing workers initiated a strike due to disagreements over a new contract. The workers rejected Boeing's offer, citing concerns about wages, job security, and benefits. The strike impacts production of military aircraft like the F-15 and F/A-18. Union leaders emphasize the need for fair compensation and respect for workers. Boeing expressed disappointment and implemented contingency plans.

title: Safira drops 'Chatwal' surname amid ₹30,000 Kapur crore feud
content: The sudden death of industrialist Sunjay Kapur has ignited a complex inheritance battle over his ₹30,000 crore estate. Key disputes revolve around the legal status of Safira, his stepdaughter, and her potential inheritance rights, further complicated by surname changes and possible implications for her biological father's estate.

title: Trump supporter thrown out of St Louis stadium mid-game after refusing to remove MAGA hat
content: A St. Louis City SC fan, Michael Weitzel, was ejected from a game for wearing a MAGA hat, sparking a debate about selective censorship. Stadium security cited the venue's Fan Code of Conduct, which prohibits unapproved political symbols. Weitzel questioned the policy's consistency, noting the presence of Pride flags.

title: 'If a statue can enter, why not a cow?': Shankaracharya criticises Parl inauguration
content: Shankaracharya Avimukteshwaranand advocated for a living cow's presence during the new Parliament building's inauguration, emphasizing its blessing. He urged Maharashtra to establish a cow felicitation protocol and proposed "Ramadhams"—cow shelters—in each constituency, rewarding caretakers financially. He supported declaring the cow as "Rashtramata" and demanded a complete ban on cow slaughter, criticizing the government's Amrit Kaal celebrations amidst ongoing slaughter.

title: 'How did Shah Rukh Khan win?' Urvashi Rautela questions jury standards in bold critique
content: Urvashi, after winning Best Supporting Actress, openly criticized the National Film Awards jury's selection criteria. She questioned Shah Rukh Khan's Best Actor win for 'Jawan' and Vijayaraghavan's supporting role categorization in 'Pookkaalam,' highlighting inconsistencies in the evaluation process. Urvashi also expressed concern over the underrepresentation of Malayalam cinema and the award for 'The Kerala Story,' prompting Kerala's CM to condemn it as divisive.

title: Drunk army constable drives onto Meerut railway platform
content: An Army constable was arrested in Meerut Cantt for allegedly driving his car onto a railway platform while intoxicated. The incident, captured in a widely circulated video, shows the car dangerously close to a passing train. Railway police intervened, confirming the constable's intoxication through a medical examination.

title: PM Modi strikes defiant ‘Make in India’ note in face of Trump’s tariff
content: Amidst global economic instability and US tariff threats, Prime Minister Modi has strongly advocated for boosting domestic consumption, emphasizing the 'Make in India' initiative. Despite US pressure, India hasn't halted Russian oil imports, prioritizing its economic interests. India defends its long-standing ties with Russia, asserting independent foreign policy.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ crosses Rs 300 cr in India but slows as ‘Mahavtar Narsimha’ takes lead
content: Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' has crossed ₹300 crore in India after a successful run, despite competition from 'Mahavtar Narsimha' and new releases. The film earned ₹6.75 crore and ₹8 crore on its third Saturday and Sunday, respectively.

title: Grandma celebrates 100th birthday in gym: Shares tip on supplements for longevity
content: Mary Coroneos, a centenarian, celebrated her 100th birthday at the gym. She inspires many with her fitness routine. Mary works out with trainers, focusing on strength and balance. Her regimen includes light weights and resistance bands. She emphasizes core strength and mobility. Mary enjoys the gym's social aspect. Her active life and healthy habits contribute to her well-being.

title: 'Siraj will be remembered ... ': Will dropped catch of Brook haunt him?
content: Mohammad Kaif believes Mohammed Siraj's dropped catch of Harry Brook could prove costly in the final Test, though his overall bowling performance might overshadow the error. Ricky Ponting echoed this sentiment, highlighting the potential expense of the missed opportunity. Ravi Shastri anticipates the drop will motivate Siraj, while acknowledging Brook's aggressive batting style shifted the momentum towards England.

title: Tejashwi's dual voter ID row: Lawyer files complaint
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav faces a police complaint filed by an advocate in Patna regarding his alleged possession of two EPICs. This action follows a notice from the Election Commission of India, which discovered discrepancies in Yadav's stated EPIC numbers.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Hope it doesn't come down to ... ' - Nasser Hussain warns England ahead of letting Chris Woakes bat
content: The Test series heads into its final morning with England at 339/6, needing 35 runs to win. India requires four wickets to level the series. Chris Woakes' shoulder injury gives India the opportunity to exploit it if he is needed to come and bat. Joe Root and Harry Brook scored centuries for England. Prasidh Krishna took three wickets for India.

title: Guns, gangs & minors: ‘Lady Don’ Zikra chargesheeted in Seelampur teen murder case
content: Delhi Police have filed a chargesheet against Zikra, infamously known as 'Lady Don,' and seven others concerning the murder of a 17-year-old boy in Seelampur. The charges include murder and criminal conspiracy. Zikra, associated with the Mastan gang, allegedly groomed teenagers for criminal activities.

title: 'It will be dramatic, but ... ' - Michael Vaughan's bold prediction ahead of series finale
content: Michael Vaughan predicts a dramatic finish to the England-India Test series as England needs 35 runs with limited wickets. Harry Brook's century and Root's ton put England in a strong position, but a late Indian fightback has kept the match alive. The final day promises high tension with India looking to level the series.

title: 'Past mistakes ... ': Ex-India cricketer on IND vs ENG Day 4 pressure battle
content: Former India batting coach Sanjay Bangar highlighted the intense pressure India exerted on England's batters during the final session of Day 4 in the fifth Test. Despite centuries from Root and Brook, India's seamers triggered a late collapse, leaving England at 339/6, needing 35 more runs.

title: Buzz from NFL training camps: What we learned about the Packers, Ravens, Titans and 13 more teams
content: Our national reporters visited 16  teams since training camps began, talking to players and coaches about what to expect this season.

title: NFLPA elects White as interim executive director
content: The NFL Players Association on Sunday night elected David White as its interim executive director, 17 days after the resignation of Lloyd Howell Jr.

title: Young wins elusive 1st PGA Tour title at Wyndham
content: Cameron Young finally got his first PGA Tour victory Sunday after seven runner-up finishes, coasting to a 2-under 68 to win the Wyndham Championship.

title: Lyles stare-down, Bednarek shove cap tense 200m
content: The U.S. track championships turned physical Sunday, with Noah Lyles and Kenny Bednarek getting involved in a shoving and shouting match as they crossed the finish line of a hotly contested 200-meter final.

title: Miami says Messi injury 'minor,' no return date set
content: Inter Miami CF captain Lionel Messi suffered a "minor" muscle injury in his right leg Saturday night in the Leagues Cup match against Necaxa at Chase Stadium.

title: Khabib hopes McGregor changes 'how he is living'
content: Retired mixed martial arts legend Khabib Nurmagomedov said he hopes former rival Conor McGregor changes how he is living or "it will be punishment all his life."

title: Fins make Sieler their highest-paid defensive player
content: The Dolphins and defensive tackle Zach Sieler agreed to a three-year extension worth up to $67.75 million, making him the team's highest-paid defensive player.

title: Ex-Vols football coach Dooley running for Senate
content: Former Tennessee football coach Derek Dooley has thrown his hat in the ring for the 2026 Republican bid for U.S. Senate to represent Georgia.

title: Rodriguez makes history with another 20-20 year
content: Julio Rodriguez homered to become the first player in major league history with 20 or more home runs and 20 or more stolen bases in each of his first four seasons.

title: 🥳 Luka celebrates with Backstreet Boys concert
content: Doncic attended the concert in Las Vegas with his teammates and members of the Lakers front office, then met members of the band.

title: Passan's MLB trade deadline awards: The team that cooked, best homecoming and ... the juggling octopus!?
content: Here's what we learned from this year's deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: How the NL West was won? Why A.J. Preller's Padres went all-in at trade deadline
content: Inside the bold deals that showed San Diego means business as it chases the defending champion Dodgers.

title: NBA all-in tiers: What all 30 teams are chasing in 2025-26
content: Not everyone can be all-in for the title in 2025-26. See each franchise's priority No. 1 for the upcoming season.

title: College football's Impatience Index: Why the clock is ticking for these 11 teams
content: CFP aspirations. Major investments. Too many losses. Fans are never patient, but these teams' might have a right.

title: Inside the winning formula that has Clemson poised for a championship run
content: With Cade Klubnik heading a large group of returnees, Dabo Swinney has Tigers fans thinking national title.

title: WNBA trade grades: Wings cut ties with Carrington, look to future
content: The Lynx added DiJonai Carrington as WNBA contenders upgrade their rosters before the Aug. 7 trade deadline.

title: Do Not Draft list: McCaffrey, Andrews among players being overvalued
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in fantasy football drafts.

title: Why Luka Doncic left guaranteed money on the table to chase an even bigger future payday
content: The Luka Era in L.A. has officially begun. Here's what you need to know about Doncic's three-year, $165 million deal.

title: From Real Madrid to Man United, have last season's issues been fixed this summer?
content: There are several big clubs that regressed in a major way last season, including Real Madrid (no defense) and Man United (scoring goals). Have these 10 clubs done enough to fix those issues in the offseason?

title: How players are using data to show their worth in contract negotiations
content: Kevin De Bruyne, Myles Lewis-Skelly and Ben White are among the top players using a data company to give them an edge in contract negotiations. But how does it work?

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Current pick right up where they left off
content: The NWSL is back from its summer break, and Kansas City Current haven't skipped a beat. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: Solak's annual ranking of all 32 NFL coaching staffs: A new No. 1 and No. 32 ahead of the season
content: We used past performance, future expectations, in-game decision-making and more to rank coaching staffs.

title: It's time for The Ocho! Check out the 2025 schedule, plus how to watch every event
content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: "India Left With No Friends": Farooq Abdullah On US Imposing 25% Tariffs
content: After the Trump announce a 25 per cent tariffs on India, former J&K Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah expressed concerns over India being left with "no friends", claiming that Donald Trump has grown closer to Pakistan.

title: Farooq Abdullah Questions Centre On Delay In Jammu And Kashmir Statehood
content: As August 5 marks six years since the abrogation of Article 370, National Conference (NC) chief Farooq Abdullah lambasted the Centre, asking about the timeline to reinstate the statehood of Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Contempt Plea By AIADMK Against 'Stalin-Named' Scheme, DMK Approaches Top Court
content: AIADMK MP and former minister C Ve Shanmugam has filed a contempt petition in the Madras High Court, alleging violation of a court order by continuing to use Chief Minister MK Stalin's name in a new government health outreach programme.

title: Tesla's $29 Billion Move To Keep Elon Musk Onboard
content: Tesla has granted CEO Elon Musk 96 million shares worth about $29 billion, a move aimed at keeping the billionaire entrepreneur at the helm as he fights a court ruling that voided his original pay deal for being unfair to shareholders.

title: Abhishek Banerjee Trinamool's New Leader In Lok Sabha
content: Abhishek Banerjee, the National General Secretary of Trinamool Congress, has been elevated to the position to parliamentary party leader of Trinamool Congress in the Lok Sabha. He is replacing Sudip Bandopadhyay.

title: "Poora Khol Diye Pasha": A Owaisi's Hyderabadi Praise For Mohammed Siraj
content: Hyderabad MP and AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi had a pure Hyderabadi response to India's big test win against England at the Oval and pacer Mohammed Siraj's five-wicket haul.

title: "Be Very, Very Careful With Nuclear Rhetoric": Russia After Trump's Submarine Order
content: The Kremlin said on Monday that everyone should be careful about nuclear rhetoric, in its first response to a statement by U.S. President Donald Trump that he had

title: "If 2 Brothers Can Come Together After 20 Years...": Raj Thackeray To Party
content: Raj Thackeray urged the party to remain united and underlined the example of his coming together with his estranged cousin Uddhav Thackeray to drive home the point.

title: Opinion: Opinion | So, Does Pakistan Really Have Those Oil 'Riches'?
content: For some years now, Pakistan has been talking about such finds, with most notably Imran Khan announcing this in early 2019. But no one knows where this oil really is.

title: She Asked Him To Destroy Phone, He Kept It. Lover's Mistake Unravels Murder
content: Tired of her criminal husband's repeated assaults under the influence of drugs, a 34-year-old woman plotted his murder. The criminal was killed and his body dumped in a canal in another state

title: Tamil Nadu Teen Found Dead At School, Family Demands Principal's Arrest
content: A Class XI student was found dead in a closed well within the school campus in Tamil Nadu's Tirupattur district, a few days after he was reported missing.

title: Gurugram Woman's Affair Exposed By Daughter. She Kills Husband, Blames Lover
content: Police in Haryana's Gurugram have arrested at least five people, including a woman and her neighbour, with whom she was allegedly having an affair, for allegedly murdering her husband and hiding his body.

title: "No Doubt Election Commission Is Removing People's Names": Prashant Kishor On Bihar Voter List
content: Jan Suraaj founder Prashant Kishor on Sunday criticised the Election Commission over the alleged removal of names from the electoral rolls

title: Home Or Pond? Dehradun Residents Struggle After Rainwater Gushes In
content: Ankle-deep water in the living room, kitchen, bedrooms and pumps at work to drain out the water: residents of an upscale locality in Dehradun are struggling to tackle rain woes and accusing the local administration of not making adequate preparations

title: AAP vs Congress In Punjab After MP's Son Gets Threat From Gangster Jaggu Bhagwanpuria
content: Udayveer, son of senior Congress leader and former Deputy Chief Minister Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa, allegedly received a death threat from Jaggu Bhagwanpuria.

title: Opinion: Opinion | MBBS In Hindi? What Madhya Pradesh's Failed Experiment Shows
content: The Madhya Pradesh experiment is failing because there are gaps. Questions abound about the acceptance of a vernacular language degree, its status in the medical fraternity and research ecosystem and its helpfulness in competitive exams.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 11 Highlights: Both Houses Adjourned For The Day
content: For the past two weeks, the Parliament has barely functioned owing to continous protests by the Opposition, demanding a special discussion on Special Intensive Revision (SIR).

title: In Uttarakhand Panchayat Polls, Winner Says Opponent Got More Votes
content: A candidate of a panchayat poll who was given the certificate of victory by the election officer here has informed authorities that he got fewer votes, urging them to declare his rival as the real winner.

title: 'Thought Delhi Was Safe': Congress MP Sudha R To NDTV After Gold Chain Snatched
content: Congress MP Sudha Ramakrishnan's gold chain was snatched in Delhi's Chanakyapuri, which houses several embassies and official residences of state governments.

title: Good response to creche centres in Bidar district
content: Koosina Mane initiative has been launched at Shishu Palana Kendras in GPs by Women and Child Welfare Department along with MGNREGA Scheme

title: A.P. BJP spokesperson Vinusha Reddy selected for IVLP
content: IVLP, established in 1940, is a foundational exchange programme designed by the U.S. to introduce emerging global leaders to their American counterparts and to U.S. society and culture

title: AIDSO opposes State govt.’s reported move to reduce pass percentage of SSLC and II PU exams
content: It will compromise the quality of education and have far-reaching negative impacts, particularly on students from government and rural schools, claims AIDSO

title: Fisherfolk in Mandapathukkuppam have only one sandy path to the beach
content: Residents say the pathway has remained damaged for nearly 15 years and in the absence of street lights, it is dangerous for them to commute at night

title: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin condoles death of Shibu Soren
content: He says the JMM leader’s life was defined by relentless resistance against exploitation and an unshakeable commitment to social justice

title: PM to consider invite to inaugurate 150th anniversary celebrations of Belagavi Bar Association
content: BJP MP Jagadish Shettar meets Narendra Modi in New Delhi to extend an invitation to him for the event

title: ₹194 crore sanctioned for construction of 100 PHCs across State: A.P. Health Minister
content: Central government has okayed 10,032 village health clinics for the State, with funds earmarked from the 14th and 15th Finance Commissions, says Satya Kumar Yadav

title: Man commits suicide, family blames Education department
content: His wife, an aided school teacher, has reportedly not received her salary for the past 12 to 14 years leading them to financial distress

title: Jain leaders to meet on Aug. 10 to condemn attack on their history, culture under the cover of Dharmasthala issue
content: Sri Gunadhar Nandi Maharaj says miscreants are making unwarranted comments on Jain rulers and trying to project them in bad light

title: Suspected Maoists carry out two IED blasts on railway tracks along Odisha-Jharkhand border
content: This comes hours after a railway personnel was killed in an IED blast on a railway track near Odisha-Jharkhand border in Sundergarh district

title: Fire breaks out at Solid Waste Management Plant in Kesare
content: A waste segregation machine and an electricity panel board were among the items that were damaged in the fire, along with plastic and other accumulated waste

title: Post-Hasina Bangladesh records 230% increase in attacks on journalists, says rights body
content: Dhaka under Chief Advisor Mohammad Yunus has been using British funds to keep its censorship authority well-oiled, the Rights and Risks Analysis Group said

title: ‘Gajapayana’ of Mysuru Dasara elephants flagged off
content: Grand event at Veeranahosahalli near Nagarahole Tiger Reserve marks the symbolic march of the nine elephants to the city of palaces for the annual festivities

title: Multiple disappearances: police intensify probe
content: The police recover more body parts from C.M. Sebastian’s house in Alappuzha, investigating the disappearances of three women.

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: NHAI to take up repair of retaining wall along vehicular underpass at Kaduvetti
content: A portion of the facia panels on the retaining walls on one side of the VUP collapsed on  Sunday, necessitating closure of the one of the two carriageways on the section

title: TMC names Abhishek Banerjee as its leader in Lok Sabha; Kalyan Banerjee resigns as party’s chief whip
content: Abhishek Banerjee, a three-time MP from Diamond Harbour, will replace veteran lawmaker from Kolkata Uttar Sudip Bandopadhyay, they said

title: Evicted people should not be given shelter: Assam CM Himanta
content: He asserted that the government will continue with its anti-encroachment drives to protect the ‘jati’ (community) if people continue to cooperate with it

title: Government will be compelled to push bills in din if Opposition's protest continues in Parliament: Kiren Rijiju
content: Kiren Rijiju made it clear that a debate on SIR cannot take place in Parliament as the exercise is part of the Election Commission's administrative action and functioning

title: Techie held for running fake online legal aid service for cybercrime victims in Bengaluru
content: The Central Crime Branch officials arrested a 37-year-old software engineer for allegedly cheating cybercrime victims by offering legal aid and escaping with the money on the pretext of service charges

title: Kamal Haasan’s comment on Sanatana Dharma sparks controversy
content: Speaking in Chennai at the 15th anniversary celebrations of Agaram Foundation, actor Suriya’s charitable organisation, Kamal said only education can break the chains of Sanatana

title: Direct and indirect involvement of KCR in Kaleshwaram project lapses highlighted by Justice P.C. Ghose Commission
content: The Commission’s report was placed before Telangana Cabinet, which met with Kaleshwaram project as single point agenda for the first time

title: My father was protective shade for Jharkhand, tribals: Hemant Soren
content: Hemant Soren broke down as party workers raised slogans hailing his father; Hemant Soren said his father fought till his last breath

title: 'Import the 3rd world, become the 3rd world': UK roads, dustbins stained with paan spits
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . toi world Desk is a dedicated team of journalists and writers who work tirelessly to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world .

title: Abhishek Banerjee named TMC leader in Lok Sabha
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: A.P. Chief Minister sets a target of per capita income of ₹5.42 lakh by the end of 2029
content: Mr. Chandrababu Naidu said all the government departments should have sector-specific plans for the short, medium and long terms in order to achieve the desired goals in a systematic manner

title: Artificial Intelligence in Tirumala darshan: a contentious debate unfolds
content: Former Chief Secretary pointed out that past Trust boards and EOs had explored the feasibility of expediting darshan through advanced technology, but were ultimately compelled to drop the proposals due to inherent structural constraints within the temple

title: Messi-led Argentina football team drops Kerala trip over scheduling clash, says State Minister
content: Kerala Sports Minister had earlier insisted that Messi-led Argentina side would visit the State as announced by the Kerala government, and that the sponsor had already paid the match fee for the event

title: He hit me, punched me; I was only doing my job: SpiceJet employee thrashed by Army officer
content: “He hit me with the bag, he punched me and slapped me till blood started oozing from my mouth and nose. Then I fell unconscious. Later I saw in the videos that he was not allowing anyone to even pick me up. He even assaulted four employees,” the injured man said

title: Clerical errors in documents “fatal” for citizenship in Assam: Study
content: Courts and tribunals interpret minor mismatches as proof that identity has not been established, says a report by the National Law School of India University and Queen Mary University of London

title: Five arrested for burglary at government doctor’s house in Panruti, 93 sovereigns of melted jewellery recovered
content: The accused were nabbed by the police during a vehicle check when they attempted to sell the stolen jewellery in Kumbakonam

title: CET and NEET: 26,555 seats in professional courses left unallocated this year in Karnataka
content: Out of the 77,140 seats available in engineering courses, 71,813 seats have been allotted, leaving 5,327 seats unallocated to any student

title: Moolampilly rehabilitation package: Dredged soil may be used for filling flood-prone sites in consultation with Cochin Port Authority
content: A clear picture about ways to stabilise the two plots may emerge at the next meeting of the Moolamppilly Rehabilitation Package Monitoring Committee, scheduled for August 22

title: Karnataka High Court directs transport unions to put strike call on hold for a day
content: A division bench comprising Justice K S Madagal and Justice M.G.S. Kamal passed the order on a PIL petition filed by J. Sunil and others, who are all dependent on public transport for their everyday commute

title: Karnataka High Court directs transport unions to put their strike call on hold for a day
content: A division bench passed the order on a PIL petitions filed by J. Sunil and others, who are all depending on the public transport for their everyday travel.

title: Navies of India, Singapore conclude SIMBEX
content: Annual SIMBEX exercise strengthens naval partnership between RSN and Indian Navy, enhancing operational competencies and mutual understanding

title: 14-year-old student found dead at home in Bengaluru
content: The boy allegedly left behind a note apologising to his family, mentioning his school friends, police said

title: GST evasion of ₹7.08 lakh crore detected in five years, includes input tax credit fraud of ₹1.79 lakh crore
content: In 2024-25 fiscal alone, more than ₹2.23 lakh crore of GST evasion were detected by CGST field officers, according to the data shared by Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary in the Lok Sabha

title: Two more arrested for indecent comments against actor and former MP Ramya in Karnataka
content: Ramya had shared the SC observations regarding the murder of Renukaswamy in which Kannada actor Darshan is among the accused, which attracted the wrath of his fans who allegedly made inappropriate comments

title: ‘Deny, distract, lie, justify’: Congress slams Modi government over 2020 Galwan standoff after Supreme Court raps Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress says the Modi government is responsible for the biggest territorial setback India has faced since 1962; accuses the government of pursuing “normalisation” with China because of its cowardice and misplaced economic priorities

title: Retired judge H.N. Nagmohan Das submits much-awaited recommendations on internal reservation for SCs in Karnataka
content: The report will be discussed by the Cabinet and is likely to be placed before the State Legislature, recommended quota within reservation matrix yet to be disclosed

title: Ungaludan Stalin, Nalam Kaakkum Stalin initiatives: Madras HC to wait for Supreme Court order on naming T.N. government schemes after living personalities
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice Sunder Mohan adjourn Tamil Nadu government’s modification plea to Thursday since DMK’s appeal is to be heard by the top court on Wednesday

title: Kerala shipwrecks: State to frame Oil Spill Contingency Plan
content: To include mapping of environmental sensitive index of oil spills along coast of Kerala and preparation of response-focussed contingency plans

title: Lok Sabha adjourned for the day as Opposition protests over Bihar SIR continue
content: Ahead of the adjournment, the Chair reminded the Opposition members that since the Monsoon session began, not even a single Bill has been passed by the House due to repeated disruptions

title: Andhra University’s affiliated colleges alerted over ‘fake Intermediate certificates’ submitted for Degree courses
content: The university has taken this decision in the wake of complaints that some candidates are allegedly getting admission in graduate programmes by submitting ‘fake intermediate’ certificates offered by the institutions in States such as Bihar, Uttar Pradesh among others

title: Shibu Soren death: Congress protest against ‘votes theft’ in Bengaluru postponed to August 8
content: The protest was rescheduled as AICC chief Mallikarjun Kharge and Mr. Gandhi have to attend the funeral ceremony of Shibu Soren on August 5 in Jharkhand.

title: Shibu Soren death: President Murmu, Modi, Rahul visit Sir Ganga Ram Hospital to pay homage
content: “Went to Sir Ganga Ram Hospital to pay homage to Shri Shibu Soren Ji. Also met his family. My thoughts are with Hemant Ji, Kalpana Ji and the admirers of Shri Shibu Soren Ji,” PM Modi said

title: Shibu Soren: From a social reformer to an iconic tribal leader
content: He played a crucial role in the creation of the separate state of Jharkhand, turning a long-standing dream into reality

title: Mysuru Dasara 2025: Gajapayana flagged off near Nagarahole forest
content: The event signals the countdown to the Mysuru Dasara, and all activities will revolve around preparations for the annual event, which highlights the culture of Karnataka, and also promotes tourism

title: Two arrested for operating illegal telephone exchange racket in Bengaluru
content: The accused would get the SIM cards from foreign countries by courier and earn around ₹5 lakh per month illegally

title: Madras High Court dismisses plea to initiate process of appointment of T.N. DGP
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice Sunder Mohan refuse to entertain a PIL plea on the ground that it is premature

title: Nalam Kaakkum Stalin scheme: AIADMK MP C.Ve. Shanmugam files contempt plea against two senior IAS officers in T.N.
content: Says, the two government officials had deliberately disobeyed court orders by launching Nalam Kaakkum Stalin scheme on August 2, 2025

title: T.N. CM Stalin inaugurates VinFast’s first EV manufacturing plant in India at Thoothukudi
content: Highlighting Tamil Nadu’s reputation as a manufacturing powerhouse, Mr. Stalin said, “Chennai is India’s Detroit.” He added that Thoothukudi was also fast emerging as an automotive hub

title: Adoor Gopalakrishnan’s remarks on Kerala govt project for SC/ST filmmakers kick up a storm, complaint filed against him
content: Adoor Gopalakrishnan insists he is ‘not against providing financial assistance to anyone, but beneficiaries should be provided adequate training and orientation before disbursal of funds’

title: Uttarakhand High Court stays scientist’s conviction in abetment of suicide case in ‘larger public interest’
content: The Uttarakhand High Court said that the research of Akash Yadav, the convicted scientist, holds critical value for the society at large

title: Security agencies gather evidence confirming Pakistani nationality of Pahalgam attackers
content: The terrorists crossed the Line of Control through north Kashmir's Gurez sector in May 2022, when the intelligence intercepts placed their radio check-in from the Pakistani side, the officials said

title: Supreme Court agrees to hear DMK’s plea against HC order barring TN govt from using name, picture of CM Stalin in welfare schemes
content: Senior advocate Mukul Rohatgi, appearing for the Tamil Nadu Government, said it has been held by the Supreme Court that the name and pictures of the CM can be used in welfare schemes

title: India, Philippines stage joint sail and naval drill in the disputed South China Sea
content: Armed Forces of the Philippines chief of staff Gen. Romeo Brawner said the two-day joint naval sail and exercises have been successful so far and expressed hopes that Filipino forces could engage India’s military in more joint maneuvers

title: Odisha motor vehicle inspector arrested for corruption; 44 plots, 1 kg gold, among valuables found
content: Golap Chandra Hansdah, working at the RTO in Boudh, was arrested after assets disproportionate to his known sources of income were found in his possession, they said

title: SIR very big issue, government must agree to debate: Priyanka Gandhi
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra asked why the opposition should not continue to raise the issue when the matter pertains to voters' list.

title: Absurd to link SIR in Bihar with Tamil Nadu, says Election Commission
content: A post by ECI, seeking to check facts in light of the charges made by former Union Minister P. Chidambaram, said, there was no need for political leaders to spread “false information” with respect to the SIR exercisce being conducted at the national level

title: Karnataka ranks second in EV charging stations on national highways
content: According to data by Ministry of Road Transport & Highways, a total of 4,557 public EV charging stations have been installed across 146,342 km stretch of National Highway across India

title: Takeaways for India from Trump moment: strategic autonomy is alive, neoliberalism is dead
content: Neither obsequiousness nor confrontation can advance India’s relations with the U.S. India should also learn that soft power is supposed to be soft, not loud and screeching

title: Rajya Sabha adjourns for the day as a mark of respect to Shibu Soren’s death
content: Deputy Chairman Harivansh announced Shibu Soren’s death in the Upper House immediately after it convened for the day, and the members observed a minute of silence to mark his death

title: Delivery worker fatally knocked down by private bus at Kalamassery in Kerala
content: He was reportedly on duty and was on his way to pick up a delivery for an online aggregator when his motorcycle was knocked down by private bus

title: Delhi Police’s description of Bengali an insult to language in which national anthem was written: Stalin
content: Ms. Banerjee had stated that a purported communication by the Delhi Police had reportedly referred to Bengali as a “Bangladeshi language”

title: Rahul Gandhi defamation case: Supreme Court stays proceedings; issues notice to State of Uttar Pradesh, complainant
content: “How did you get to know that 2,000 sq km of Indian territory was occupied? Were you there? Do you have any credible proof?” Justice Dipankar Datta criticised Rahul Gandhi

title: 678th Bahmani empire foundation day celebrated in Kalaburagi
content: Sultan Alauddin Hasan Bahman Shah established his capital, Ahsanabad (now Kalaburagi), on August 3, 1347

title: Shibu Soren’s death: Jharkhand Assembly Monsoon Session adjourned sine die
content: Legislators inside the Assembly raised slogans such as ‘Shibu Soren Amar Rahe’ (Long live Shibu Soren) as soon as the House assembled for the day

title: Uttar Pradesh floods: 'Failed' government focussed on event management than public welfare, says Akhilesh Yadav
content: In a post on X, the former Chief Minister said when the State Government can organise "super VVIP" rallies, why has it failed to carry out relief and rescue operations in the flood-affected areas

title: How McLaren's split strategies helped Norris upset Piastri
content: the battle of the McLarens between lando Norris and Oscar Piastri has sparked a heated debate . a battle between the two drivers had come within centimeters of a collision on the penultimate lap of the Hungarian Grand Prix . the battle was the same: i've always promised to allow its drivers to race, and i think it's a good race!

title: Night 2 results: Lesnar returns, Rhodes wins undisputed WWE championship
content: SummerSlam Night 2 featured the latest installment of the  John Cena retirement tour , as he put his Undisputed WWE Championship up for grabs against former titleholder Cody Rhodes at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey. After a marathon "street fight" match, Rhodes won his title back from the legend Cena. After the match, Brock Lesnar made his return to the WWE, delivering an F-5 to a stunned Cena. That was the final of many title matches on Night 2. Naomi retained her title in the opening match of the card, and Becky Lynch retained hers with a win over Lyra Valkyria. Later, Solo Sikoa outlasted Jacob Fatu in a steel cage match to retain the United States Championship, and Dominik Mysterio held on to the men's Intercontinental Championship with a win over AJ Styles. ESPN reporter Greg Wyshynski highlights the biggest moments and more from SummerSlam Night 2.

title: Brewers playing it safe with Misiorowski
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . sportsmail's fantasy baseball fantasy writers have contributed to the news cycle . the sports , Chicago White Sox , Seattle Mariners and the Washington Nationals are the only clubs that are not in action .

title: Benson, Higgins headline 'have skills, need opportunity' team
content: the Cincinnati Bengals running back is one of the best examples in recent memory . he was a 12th-round pick and the 34th running back off the board last season . his explosive ability quickly earned him the lion's share of the rushing chores .

title: From star to outcast: Examining Rodrygo's fall from grace at Real Madrid, next steps
content: real madrid forward has gone from undisputed star to controversial figure in just a few months . he scored two goals in 60 seconds against manchester city in 2022 . the real star has lost his place in the starting lineup and his future is uncertain .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Newcastle eye Ramos as Sesko backup

title: 32 teams can make the College Football Playoff
content: the 12-team college football playoff will again include the five highest-ranked conference champions . there are 32 teams -- the most in the CFP era -- with at least a 10% chance of reaching the playoff . the list will shrink by November, but below it starts with 32 teams ranked in order of their percentage chance .

title: What would Cowboys' pass rush look like without Micah Parsons?
content: Jerry Jones says he won't trade Micah Parsons . the Cowboys reset the franchise by trading their best player, Herschel Walker, to the Minnesota Vikings . parsons has 52.5 sacks in his first four seasons .

title: Training camp battles to watch for all 32 teams: Pats, Steelers, Packers need WRs to step up
content: players are battling for positions on the depth chart at training camps across the NFL . coaches are seeking clarity on who starts and who will provide backup . the los Angeles Rams are looking to secure their third receiving option behind Davante Adams and Puka Nacua .
